vaccinations:
Pet Dog - Less than 3 Months

  • No rabies vaccination is required if the dog is less than 3 months old.

Personal Pet Dog - 3 to 8 Months

  • A valid rabies vaccination certificate is required.
  • The dog must have been at least 3 months of age at the time of vaccination.

Personal Pet Dog - 8 Months or Older

  • A valid rabies vaccination certificate is required.
  • The rabies vaccination certificate must include:
    • Written in English or French, or with an official translation.
    • Issued and signed by a licensed veterinarian.
    • Identifies the dog (age, breed, sex, color/markings, weight, and microchip/tattoo number, if applicable).
    • Indicates the date of rabies vaccination and the trade name of the vaccine.
    • Specifies the period of validity (typically 1 year unless otherwise specified by the veterinarian).

The European Union pet passport is an acceptable alternative to the rabies vaccination certificate, as long as it includes all required elements.
certifications:
Pet Dog - Less than 3 Months

  • No health certification is required if the dog is less than 3 months old.

Personal Pet Dog - 3 to 8 Months

  • A health certificate may be substituted for a rabies vaccination certificate under specific circumstances, such as medical exemptions.
  • The health certificate must include the following:
    • Be written in English or French.
    • Be issued on clinic letterhead and signed by a licensed veterinarian.
    • Identify the animal (age, breed, sex, color/markings, weight, and microchip/tattoo number if applicable).
    • State that the dog has been in Mexico since birth or for at least 6 months preceding entry into Canada.
description:
Personal Pet Dog - Less than 3 Months

When you arrive in Canada with a personal pet dog under 3 months of age, the dog must appear healthy and meet humane transportation requirements.

Personal Pet Dog - 3 to 8 Months

When you arrive in Canada with a personal pet dog aged 3 to 8 months, you will need a valid rabies vaccination certificate, or a health certificate, and the dog must appear healthy and meet humane transportation requirements.

Personal Pet Dog - 8 Months or Older

When you arrive in Canada with a personal pet dog aged 8 months or older, you will need a valid rabies vaccination certificate, and the dog must appear healthy and meet humane transportation requirements.
microchip: Not required for personal pet dogs entering Canada from Mexico unless they fall under the commercial category (such as dogs for breeding, sale, or show). Commercial dogs under 8 months of age must be identified with an electronic microchip.
assistancePet:
Assistance Dogs

Assistance dogs are exempt from the rabies vaccination requirements, provided that they meet the following conditions:

  • The dog is accompanied by its designated handler (the person to whom the dog is assigned).
  • Documentation is presented to prove that the dog is trained and certified by an organization accredited by Assistance Dogs International or the International Guide Dog Federation.
  • The dog appears healthy and meets humane transportation requirements.

All required original documentation must be available for inspection at the port of entry, and a hard copy is strongly recommended.
humaneTransport:
Humane Transportation Requirements

Canada has strict regulations to ensure the humane transport of animals, including dogs. The dog must be transported in a manner that prevents injury, harm, or suffering during the journey.

Learn more about Canadaâ€™s humane transport requirements here.
